DOC.brief_summary: The objective study directly compare 6 session in-person Internet administer Cognitive-Behavior Therapy Insomnia ( CBTi ) Minimal Contact control ( MC ) , within active duty military population determine comparative benefit intervention improvement sleep well domains strongly relate insomnia depression , substance abuse , PTSD symptom . A total 189 military personnel chronic insomnia , age 18-65 , recruit randomized receive 6-sessions ( 6 week ) CBTi ( n=77 ) , ICBTi ( n=35 ) , MC control ( n=77 ) condition . The investigator compare three group subjective objective measure sleep . The CBTi MC control group compare variable interest ( e.g. , depression , substance abuse , PTSD symptom ) predictor outcomes .
DOC.brief_title: Comparing Internet In-Person Brief Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Insomnia
DOC.criteria: Chronic Insomnia define Research Diagnostic Criteria ( RDC ) criteria41 Complaint > 3 month ( chronic insomnia ) disturb sleep > 3 nights/week ( severe insomnia ) define least one follow assessed sleep diary : Sleep Onset Latency > 30 min ( initial insomnia ) and/or Wake After SleepOnset > 30 min ( middle insomnia ) and/or Early Morning Awakening > 30 min desire wakeup time ( late insomnia ) Sleep Efficiency < 85 % Active Duty military member station Fort Hood assess selfreport . History deploy support OIF OEF assess selfreport . â€¢ Stable psychotropic and/or hypnotic medication least one month assess selfreport review medical record .
